answerText: adenosine [or ADO][10] This alkaloid drug antagonizes adenosine receptors by mimicking the nucleoside's purine structure, much like the similar xanthine derivatives theophylline and theobromine.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 6 | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The anti-hairy cell leukemia drug cladribine mimics this compound and inhibits its namesake deaminase enzyme. [10] Name this vasodilator that is used to treat some tachycardias and is a nucleoside whose "triphosphate" derivative is the unit of energy for metabolic processes.
